Facultad de la UC a Carabineros: "Rechazamos enérgicamente la violencia que ejercen"
Desde el Campus de San Joaquín efectuaron un comunicado por los hechos sucedidos con algunos estudiantes del establecimiento con la policía.
07 Nov 2019 by Claudio Caldera
Una dura crítica a Carabineros de Chile efectuó este miércoles la facultad de historia, geografía y ciencia política de la Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile.
Por medio de un comunicado, dijeron rechazar enérgicamente la violencia ejercida por Carabineros ante las manifestaciones que ocurrieron durante esta jornada en el Campus de San Joaquín.
"Es inaceptable que la fuerza policial dispare indiscriminadamente gases lacrimógenos y perdigones hacia el interior del campus, efectando a toda la comunidad", comenzaron diciendo.
En esa línea, añadieron que "cinco estudiantes de nuestro instituto fueron heridos y heridas por perdigones y la directora de asuntos estudiantiles de nuestra facultad fue golpeada en la cabeza por una bomba lacrimógena observada desde la distancia lo que ocurría. Todos han sido atendidos y atendidas y se encuentran fuera de peligro".
"Eventos como estos sólo confirman que las declaraciones del Gobierno relativas a permitir e incluso celebrar la legítima y pacífica protesta de la ciudadanía, son poco creíbles", lanzaron desde la facultad de la UC.

Faculty of the UC to Carabineros: "We strongly reject the violence they exercise"
From the San Joaquin Campus they made a statement about the events that happened with some students of the establishment with the police.
07 Nov 2019 by Claudio Caldera
A harsh criticism of Carabineros de Chile on Wednesday made the faculty of history, geography and political science of the Pontifical Catholic University of Chile.
Through a statement, they said they strongly reject the violence exerted by police officers before the demonstrations that occurred during this day at the San Joaquin Campus.
"It is unacceptable that the police force indiscriminately fires tear gas and pellets into the campus, affecting the entire community," they began.
In that line, they added that "five students of our institute were injured and injured by pellets and the director of student affairs of our faculty was hit in the head by a tear gas bomb observed from a distance what was happening. All have been taken care of and taken care of. and they are out of danger. "
"Events such as these only confirm that the Government's statements regarding allowing and even celebrating the legitimate and peaceful protest of citizenship are not credible," they launched from the faculty of the UC.
